lexUnit.name: count.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: regard or be regarded as possessing a quality or fulfilling a role

sentence.text: But Christ does for him have a uniqueness ; and thus I count his position a Christian one .
I 've watched you for years , you and your silly ways , and you can count yourself lucky you 've got a 'usband like Jack .
The debate is interesting , for it becomes evident that women who count themselves feminists may otherwise have a very different sense of reality .
I count Upper Ribblesdale amongst my favourite places on earth .
I count it a privilege to have been asked to become its chairman -- though naturally I would wish it had been in happier circumstances .
And if I could bring him to reconciliation with the king , without more bloodshed and without revenge , I would count it a good deed both for England and Wales .
For just Â£14,000 couples could count themselves among Sinatra 's guests .
As we mentioned above , it only makes sense to count substitutions as errors when a grammar is used .
Andrew will be much missed by all the many who had the good fortune to count him as a colleague and a friend .
If that 's to be counted eccentricity , then Evan was an eccentric .
Mrs. Berrio 's family counts itself lucky : her 40-year-old husband Alejandro has a job .
Vietnam counts more than 300,000 of its own soldiers as missing .
Anyone who has worked an hour or more in the last week of a given month is counted as fully employed in Japan .
Each month served in the battle zone is counted as three months of active duty and extra leave time is earned .
Yes , she admits , those who have stopped looking do n't come to her office and do n't get counted as unemployed .
The actual time Abequa , 47 , will serve in prison is 11 years since each year in jail is counted as nine months , legal advisers said .
But he vehemently defended the priest , saying , `` I count him , and I think he counts me as well , as a friend .
Talks begin Tuesday in Vienna to take into account forces and armaments in countries such as Poland , Hungary and the Czech Republic that had been counted as part of an east bloc .
The Dome of the Rock remains Jerusalem 's most striking monument ; it is counted among the most beautiful buildings ever created .
